title: The Number One Difference Between J Sainsbury plc And Tesco plc
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Sun, Sep 20, 2015, 13:36 BST - UK Markets closed The Number One Difference Between J Sainsbury plc And Tesco plc By Owain Bennallack | Fool.co.uk – 35 minutes ago 174.65 -1.60 
Most of us don't give much thought to which supermarket we go to these days -- they've all become interchangeably similar, and the biggest factor influencing where to shop is which one is the nearest. Nevertheless there is one massive difference been Sainsbury's (LSE: SBRY) and Tesco (LSE: TSCO) that you won't notice on your weekly shop. 
To find out the strategies to adopt if you want to become one of the growing number of surprise UK millionaires , read this FREE Motley Fool report: ' 7 Simple Steps For Seeking Serious Wealth ' while it remains available! 

Owain Bennallack owns shares in Tesco. The Motley Fool UK has no position in any of the shares mentioned. We Fools don't all hold the same opinions, but we all believe that considering a diverse range of insights makes us better investors.
